result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas Lee Hyde

records.addlTxt:
MATTER NOT CALLED ON THE RECORD: Defendant Thomas Lee Hyde not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Alyssa M. Schaller in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court has reason to believe the notice of hearing did not get to Mr. Hyde in time for today's hearing.
Defendant has a hearing date previously set for 11/28/2022 at 8:30.  Court to resend the notice to Mr. Hyde.

Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Form dated 10-13-2022 re: request for speedy trial and request for sooner hearing date.  .  
**Reviewed by Judge Melvin on 10-20-2022:  move next hearing to a sooner day, Wednesday, 10/25 if possible.

Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Forms (3) dated 10-11-2022, requesting bail hearing/bail reduction. 
**10-18-2022 - defendant posted cash bond and is no longer in custody.
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.

2:41 PM Defendant Thomas Lee Hyde in court, in custody. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder.  Defendant states his attorney was not notified of this hearing date.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
Hearing scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Thomas Lee Hyde
Current: 2355 S 14th St, Milwaukee, WI 53215 United States  (Effective: 10-10-2022)
Prior: 4036 S 43Rd St, Greenfield, WI 53220
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
